geeklist.title: Year End Aussie Maths Trade 2013.
geeklist.description:
Welcome to the Year End Aussie Maths Trade 2013.
This is proudly brought you by:
[floatleft][username=Friendless][/floatleft][floatleft][username=mr_lunch][/floatleft][floatleft][username=Amiguero][/floatleft][clear]
[b][size=14]Rules:[/size][/b]
:d10-1: This trade is open to Australian BGGers only.
:d10-2: This trade is open to board games, expansions, card games, game accessories, RPG, video games and the like. Please don't add anything else. If you intend to allow a game to be exchanged for cash (i.e. you're selling), include the amount you will accept for it in the price. You may consider compare current market prices (ebay, BGG market, local shop)
:d10-3: Golden rule: [b][size=12]SENDER PAYS SHIPPING[/size][/b]. Even if you're selling a game for cash, or you post from Perth to Townsville or Hobart. So, make sure you set your price high enough that you would be happy to pay shipping to anywhere else in Australia out of that money. By posting an item to this list you are agreeing that you can and will mail it anywhere in Australia at your expense.
:d10-4: Items included in the maths trade are expected to remain as part of the maths trade until the closing date. [b][COLOR=#FF0033]If your intention is to sell an item there are other alternatives in BGG to do so[/COLOR][/b]. If an item is not longer available for whatever reason, please [b]DELETE[/b] it. [size=12]If you decide to drop an item from the list, please do so [u]before the due date of the game submission deadline[/u].[/size] List order will be as per submissions. Note: your items could end up with a different item number due to deletions, so please check the official after the geeklist has been closed. Refer to the deadlines below.
[COLOR=#990000][size=14]After the date of the first deadline, don't delete your items. If you don't want to trade them anymore, simple submit an empty want list.[/size][/COLOR]
:d10-5: Provide as much details as possible (edition, language, sleeved cards, game condition, etc). Pick a picture that represents the game you're offering if there are multiple versions. If necessary, take a picture of the game, upload it to your gallery, and use that image. Feel free to use the game condition rating previously suggested by petegs to describe your items:
[b]New in shrink[/b] - which means never opened. [b]Opened but unpunched[/b] - I've looked at the game but not punched counters yet or stickered blocks etc. [b]Opened and punched[/b] - Looked at, even punched counters etc but haven't played. [b]Opened and played[/b].
Count pieces to make sure the games are complete, and accurately list any components that are missing or damaged. Please look at your trade pile to make sure the game is really there. In order to make your items more (or less) appealing, you may want to add one or more "sweeteners" to the item listing -- an expansion, a related game, or a completely unrelated item that you think will make it a more desirable package. Items for which there is no BGG listing can be listed as Miscellaneous Game Accessory.
:d10-6: Cash option is available. Australian BGGers can participate even without submitting an item to the trade with the cash option by submitting want list before the due date.
:d10-7: Maths Traders will not be required to add cash value to the geeklist - that will be handled in the want lists. In the case that a buyer offers more than a seller is asking, the buyer will pay the seller's price.
:d10-8: There is no limit of items to be submitted in this trade. Duplicates of items already on the list are fine. Traders can combine multiple games into one item (e.g. 7 Wonders plus expansions).
:d10-9: Keep comments for listed items to a minimum. There is a separate thread for any ad hoc messages.
:d10-1::d10-0: [b][size=12]Deadlines:[/size][/b]
Add items to the list by: [-][size=10][b]10pm Sunday 5 January 2014[/b][/size]. EST (SYD/CBR) Australian Time[/-]
Official item list posted by: [-][b]10pm Tuesday 7 January 2014[/b][/-]. EST (SYD/CBR) Australian Time
Want Lists due by: [size=14][b]10pm Friday 10 January 2014[/b][/size]. EST (SYD/CBR) Australian Time
[COLOR=#000099][b]Want list submission via GeekMail to[/b] [/COLOR]
[user=Friendless][/user]
Official Results posted at Friendless discretion from during weekend 11-12 January 2014.
No extensions for deadlines above will be granted. For respect to your fellow Maths Traders and to have enough time as people may need to get their games to a willing 'games mule' attending CanCon.
[geekurl=/wiki/page/Aussie_Maths_Trade#]Wiki:[/geekurl]
If you require further details about Maths Trade information and how to prepare your want list, please refer to the Assie Math Trade wiki.
If you would like to post comments about the MT the thread is below:
[geekurl=/thread/1074036/year-end-aussie-maths-trade-2013-discussion][b]Year End Aussie Maths Trade 2013 Discussion[/b][/geekurl]
Finally, please let others know that Aussie maths trade is now open.
Thank you all for your participation.

[q="Moose_Head"]The AusPost [url=https://www.clickandsend.com.au/AustraliaPost/]ClickAndSend[/url] stuff (max weight 15kg), flat rate, Australia wide if required, is a good guide to cost (including box, packing materials, postage) for sending games. The pricing is incredibly generous and was created as a partnership between eBay and AusPost, though you do not need to be an eBay user to take advantage of this. Cheaper options will exist for postage within the same state. All costs include free online tracking of delivery:
[c][b]Box Width Depth Height Post Cost Box Cost C&S Code[/b] Bx1 220mm 160mm 77mm $7.15 $1.75 00069 Bx2 310mm 225mm 102mm $11.70 $2.35 00076 Bx4 430mm 305mm 140mm $15.05 $3.20 00090[/c] [hr]For the person sending, they need to register. Their interface will infuriate the hell out of technically competent people. and you will need to enter one of the promo codes: B1: 00069, B2: 00076, B4: 00090 and hit
[size=12][BGCOLOR=#868686][COLOR=#FFFFFF] Search [/COLOR][/BGCOLOR][/size]
(Using example of 00090 B4) It will then auto fill details such as: [floatleft][b]Packaging type[/b] [hr]AP/eBay FLAT RATE Bx4 Box[/floatleft][floatleft][b]Weight[/b] [hr]15.000 kg[/floatleft][floatleft][b]Length[/b] [hr]43.00 cm[/floatleft][floatleft][b]Width[/b] [hr]30.50 cm[/floatleft][floatleft][b]Height[/b] [hr]14.00 cm[/floatleft] [clear]If you do that it will then give you the promo pricing as well as fill in the dimensions. Pricing will appear once you select
[size=12][BGCOLOR=#FF3300][COLOR=#FFFFFF] Search available services [/COLOR][/BGCOLOR][/size].
* Prices effective April 8, 2013[/q]

item.comment: I already own mondo. How different is this?

[q="tiggers"]I already own mondo. How different is this?[/q]
Well, it adds a couple of things. There's one less terrain type but roads which you need to try to connect up (orthogonally to terrain). This also makes it harder to have terrain segments.
In the advanced/expert/pony game, rather than having common goals, you need to grab and place an in-map scoring tile from a set (after you already have some tiles down) in order to be scored for one of the advanced landscape features. This adds a mad dash at the start as people, e.g. try to grab the hunting hut since they can see lots of scorable forest+boar tiles.
The net result is that it's a bit more thinky and less relaxed.

item.comment:
I've had a difficult time trying to figure out what cash price to put on this one - and don't want to edit the geeklist item now that the list is officially closed.
After doing some research, it looks like the Kickstarter version of Boss Monster is [thread=1082310]pretty rare[/thread]. Opened copies in similar condition seem to be going for AU$80 minimum recently with some going for considerably more. The base game also appears to be a [listitem=2994010]very popular title for game stores[/listitem].
$95 or trade.

Condition: Opened and played; excellent condition. One missing "1 taler" coin (one of nine). There are normally 24 coins (-1 here) in 3 denominations (9x1 Taler(8 here), 6x2 Taler, 9x5 Taler). In the standard rules players have a 15 taler limit. So there is enough currency for 4 players to reach this limit still and I doubt the missing taler would make a difference.

Well, there's a funny story about this one. When I won it in the last trade I got a little bit excited and ordered the novel from bookdepository. So I read this 1400 page novel, in French, only to find out that the novel is much much better than the game, in fact it's not really clear the game is based on the novel at all.
Do not bother playing this game just because you're a fan of the novel.
On the other hand, if you want a very light game (i.e. probably a kids' game) with some interesting mechanics, go for it.
item.comment: [c] [/c] I have a copy of [i][url=http://www.amazon.com/The-Pillars-Earth-Ken-Follett/dp/0451166892]The Pillars of the Earth[/url][/i] if you want to read it...

Watched all of BSG just to enjoy the game more. Series is better than the game, but the game ends better :). Never would have look at Game of Thrones unless FFG put out the board game. Watched the Pillars Miniseries too. Good Cast. Not enamored by game however.

item.comment: David- what colours are this set?
The image I chose is representative (light blue and pale yellow/cream tiles). There isn't an image of this edition's box in the game's gallery: 2009 New Zealand release, box colours green and purple.

I play-tested this game a load of times at gamerz.net. When it got published the designer asked what colours to make it in. I play yellow and my wife plays blue, but I said "no matter what you do, make it impossible to play for Rob and Erin". That was 4 years before I met them, but I'm a vindictive bastard.

:p
We are quite happy with a blue/cream set just like the one pictured. But thanks John- it's nice to be thought of.

item.objectname: Crossbows and Catapults: Sea Battle Set
item.body:
This has humungous ship miniatures and all sorts of other goodies! Good to beef up any other C&C sets you may have.
All pieces in very good condition! All original stickers looking good! Missing 2 cardboard ruler pieces. Not essential to gameplay, they were just flimsy card rulers. Not the sort of game you really care that much about measuring anything anyway! Missing 3 cardboard scenery pieces. These are flimsy extra barriers you can use, but are not essential.
The box is in pretty good "op shop" condition... some box wear and some minor bits of sticky tape etc.
Trade or sale ($50).

This is a card game produced through the IndieGoGo crowdfunding website. You are trying to have your Survivors outrun the Zombie Horde (and the other Survivors) to get to the safety of the bunker. It's kind of like Guillotine with zombies, but with more control/less chaos. It's fun!
Trade for game or $16.
I will be at Cancon.

[b]Glory To Rome: Black Box: The Apology Letter![/b]
Excellent Condition.
This is a handwritten letter (addressed to me and dated 19 June, 2012) from Ed Carter, Managing Director of Cambridge Games Factory. (It includes the address of the house he no longer owns.) Individuals who pledged at certain levels of the (disastrous) Kickstarter campaign were given the benefit of receiving this letter. It was supposed to be an apology for inflicting the art from the original version of the game on the game-buying public. But, after all the troubles of the Kickstarter campaign, it ended up being an apology for the late deliveries of the game to Australia. (So, even the apology letter was not what it was advertised to be...)
Now you can own a piece of Kickstarter and Glory To Rome history!
Trade for game or $20.
I will be at Cancon.

[b]SMALL GAME MANIA![/b]
[thing=35766][/thing] Essentially Password using game names (mostly Euros, but also some Ameritrash and family classics). It was given out to attendees of Alan Moon's Gathering Of Friends in 2008. On this copy, I've marked some of the cards in A Game Of Games to indicate which I've played. This will not affect playability for you at all.
PLUS
[thing=96672][/thing] [ImageID=966113] Ted Alspach, creator of the "Board 2 Pieces" comic strip, follows his Start Player game with the ability to always resolve ties. No longer will "players rejoice in their shared victory"! Includes a giant TieBreaker meeple and 54 cards. (Note: The box incorrectly says 60 cards, but the game actually comes with just 54.)
PLUS
[thing=2843][/thing] [ImageID=328550] A children's card game co-designed by Leo Colovini!
Trade all three for a game or $15.
I will be at Cancon.
